actions: Tonifies the Middle Jiao, augments Qi, tonifies the Lungs, nourishes the Blood and promotes the generation of Body Fluids.
With Wu Wei Zi and Mai Men Dong, for injury to Qi and fluids with shortness of breath and thirst.
Nourishes Yin, moistens the Lungs, generates Fluids, stops cough, clears Heat from the Heart and eliminates irritability.
With Sheng Di Huang, for hematemesis or epistaxis due to Yin Deficiency with Excess Heat.
Astringes Lung Qi, generates Fluids, tonifies Qi and nourishes Kidney Yin.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, nourishes Yin, generates fluids and increases saliva.
Stabilizes the Kidneys, astringes Jing and Body Fluids, stops excessive sweating, supports that which has collapsed, tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin and strengthens Kidney Yang.
With Wu Wei Zi, for spermatorrhea, abnormal sweating, palpitations and shortness of breath due to Yin and Yang Deficiency of the Liver and Kidneys.
Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, warms and stabilizes the Kidneys and prevents leakage.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
With Dang Shen, for anorexia, fatigue and loose stools due to Spleen Deficiency.

symptoms: Dizziness which is worse on exertion
Shortness of breath on slight exertion
Palpitations with a stifling sensation in chest
manifestations.tongue: Red and dry or Pink and dry or Pale with teethmarks on its edges and a red tip
manifestations.tongueCoat: Thin and dry or Little or None
manifestations.pulse: Deficient and rapid or Irregular and slow or Thready and deficient or Consistently irregular
